document.docAuthor: Lee, Bee Yan, Forges, Bertrand Richer De & Ng, Peter K. L.
document.docTitle: Rochinia boucheti Richer de Forges & Ng 2013
document.masterDocTitle: Deep-sea spider crabs of the family Epialtidae MacLeay, 1838, from Papua New Guinea, with a redefinition of Tunepugettia Ng, Komai & Sato, 2017, and descriptions of two new genera (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Majoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Deep-sea spider crabs of the family Epialtidae MacLeay, 1838, from Papua New Guinea, with a redefinition of Tunepugettia Ng, Komai & Sato, 2017, and descriptions of two new genera (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Majoidea)

bibRefCitation.author: Richer de Forges, B. & Ng, P. K. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Richer de Forges, B. & Ng, P. K. L. (2013) On a collection of spider crabs of the genera Rochinia A. Milne-Edwards, 1875 and Naxioides A. Milne-Edwards, 1865 (Crustacea, Brachyura, Majoidea, Epialtidae) from Mozambique Channel, Solomon, Vanuatu and Philippine Islands, with description of a new species of Rochinia. In: Ahyong, S. T., Chan, T. Y., Corbari, L. & Ng, P. K. L. (Eds.), Tropical Deep-sea Benthos 27. Museum national d'Histoire naturelle, Paris, pp. 467 - 483.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rochinia boucheti
Richer de Forges & Ng, 2013: 474
, figs. 5, 6, 8E–H ( type locality Solomon Islands ).

10 September 2007

Remarks.
Rochinia boucheti Richer de Forges & Ng, 2013
, was described from the Solomon Islands with only two specimens collected between 371 and
456 m .
Interestingly, it is more abundant in the PNG collection studied here. The three deep-sea cruises BIOPAPUA, MADEEP, and KAVIENG collected
R . boucheti
from
421 to 766 m
.

The PNG specimens show variations in the number of sharp granules on the carapace (excluding hepatic and lateral branchial spines), with either 17, 19 or 20 granules, and differences in the number of mesogastric granules medially, with either 5 or 6 granules.
Rochinia boucheti
is recorded for the first time from PNG .
